name: Path N Stomach
title: Pathologic N
notes:
**Note 1:** Histological examination of a regional lymphadenectomy specimen will ordinarily include 16 or more lymph nodes. If the lymph nodes are negative, but the number ordinarily examined is not met, classify as pN0. (1)

**Note 2:**  Code only regional nodes and nodes, NOS, in this field.  Distant nodes are coded in M (distant metastasis).

**Note 3:**  Assign N1 if regional lymph nodes are involved but there is no indication of the number of nodes involved.

**Note 4:**  Assign as regional node metastases when there are metastatic nodules in the fat adjacent to a gastric carcinoma WITHOUT evidence of residual lymph node tissue; assign as M (distant metastases) for nodules implanted on peritoneal surfaces.

**Regional lymph nodes for Stomach are:**

    Celiac:
       Hepatic  
    Hepatoduodenal (for lesser curvature)    
    Left gastric (superior gastric), NOS:
       Cardial
       Cardioesophageal
       Gastric, left
       Gastropancreatic, left
       Lesser curvature
       Lesser omental
       Paracardial
    Nodule(s) in perigastric fat    
    Pancreaticosplenic (pancreaticolienal)
    Pancreaticoduodenal
    Perigastric, NOS
    Peripancreatic
    Right gastric (inferior gastric), NOS:
       Gastrocolic
       Gastroduodenal
       Gastroepiploic (gastro-omental), right or NOS
       Gastrohepatic
       Greater curvature
       Greater omental
       Pyloric, NOS: infrapyloric, subpyloric, suprapyloric
    Splenic (lienal), NOS:
        Gastroepiploic (gastro-omental), left
        Splenic hilar

    Regional lymph nodes, NOS
    Lymph nodes, NOS
footnotes: (1) International Union Against Cancer (UICC) *TNM Classification of Malignant Tumors,* 7th ed., Sobin, LH, Gospodarowicz, M, Wittekind, CH, eds. New York: Wiley, 2009, pg., 76
rows: Regional lymph nodes cannot be assessed

Surgical resection of primary and pathologic assessment of regional nodes are done but involvement of regional nodes not stated
Surgical resection of primary and pathologic assessment of regional nodes are done but involvement of regional nodes not documented in patient record

Regional lymph nodes, NOS
Lymph nodes, NOS

Stated as N1
Metastasis in 7 or more regional lymph nodes

Note: N3 has subcategories of N3a and N3b. Assign N3 only when there is no information available to assign one of the subcategories

Stated as N3 [NOS]
Metastasis in 16 or more regional lymph nodes
Clinically no nodes positive and no pathologic evaluation of nodes
In situ case as defined by TNM and there is a resection of the primary but the nodes are not evaluated pathologically
Pathologic N is not defined for the specific site/histology

No pathologic evaluation of regional lymph nodes and case is not in situ
Regional lymph node(s) cannot be assessed pathologically
No resection of a known primary (not T0)
No surgical resection of primary tumor and no positive biopsy of the highest N 
Unknown if any pathologic assessment performed
